title: TreeExplainer one and zero paths understanding
body:
Hi everyone,

We try to understand the algorithm of the TreeExplainer proposed here. We read the different articles and the code but still  we have a question regarding "one" and "zero" paths.

We did not understand what the vectors "zero" paths and the "one" paths mean. In the article "_Consistent Individualized Feature Attribution for Tree Ensembles_" ([https://arxiv.org/pdf/1802.03888.pdf]), we find the following definition:
"_z the fraction of “zero” paths (where this feature is not in the set S) that flow through this branch, o the fraction of “one” paths (where this feature is in the set S) that flow through this branch_"

We expected those vectors to have the length of the number of features (to indicate if a feature is or is not in a path). But instead, we find that _parent_one_fractions_  and _parent_zero_fractions_ have a higher length.

Can someone clear this for us or knows articles with more details ?

thanks
